column1: '''Tincotéma''' was one of the four series of the [[Tengwar]] writing system.  As with all of the series it consisted of six characters in each of six ''[[Tyellë|tyeller]]'' or 'grades'.  This particular series took its name from the first of its signs
column3: but here simply representing the character 't').

column1: Half of the symbols in this series had one bow or ''[[lúva]]'' while the other half had two bows.  All bows in this series were open
column2: curving downwards and to the right from a stem
the characters in this series could represent a variety of different sounds
column3: though in practice their use had become essentially standardised by the [[Third Age]] to [[Wikipedia:Alveolar consonant|alveolar]] and [[Wikipedia:Dental consonant|dental]] consonants.

column1: The first four signs in the series
column5: each represented a variant of the basic 't' sound: 't'
column11: and finally ''[[óre]]'' indicated a weak 'r' sound.<ref>{{App|Letters}}</ref>
